meta.title: Home - Jackson County School District

body.class: fsLiveMode fsHasHeader fsHasFooter fsHasOneColumnLayout home fsHasTheme2 district-theme

input.name: q
input.title: search
input.style: width: 100%; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: -0.0625em 0px 0px; height: 1.25em; outline: none;

div.div:
Climb the mountains and get their good tidings. The winds will blow their own freshness into you, and the storms their energy, while cares will drop off like autumn leaves.
–John Muir, Our National Parks, 1901

The link between leadership and learning is not only essential at the community level. It is even more indispensable in world affairs.
–JOHN F. KENNEDY, 1963

Our progress as a nation can be no swifter than our progress in education. The human mind is our fundamental resource.
–JOHN F. KENNEDY, 1961

The arts, quite simply, nourish the soul. They sustain, comfort, inspire. They make our lives richer, more compassionate, more fulfilled.
–E. GORDON GEE, 2015

section.class: fsElement fsNews fsList fsItemCount_1 fsThumbnailAlignLeft fsThumbnailOriginal fsThumbnailMedium

div.p: Jackson County Public Schools will hold the annual Kick-Off to Kindergarten on Monday, March 23rd from 1:00 p.m. to 6:00 p.m. at the Sylva Comfort Inn. Children who turn five years old on or before August 31st are eligible to enroll for the 2020-2021 school year.

header.div: Our students enjoy an abundance of opportunities to connect through relevant, authentic, and meaningful learning experiences. We believe that what happens both inside and outside the classroom helps our students discover their passions and develop their talents.

div.class: fsElement fsMedia fsPlayer sortable-media athletics fsSingleItem
fsElement fsMedia fsPlayer sortable-media arts fsSingleItem
fsElement fsMedia fsPlayer sortable-media extra fsSingleItem

header.div: Our belief that every child can learn and achieve is the core of who we are. Our family of graduates is evidence of that value, and their success demonstrates our commitment to lifelong learning.

div.p:
2014-Present PEN/Bellwether Prize for Socially Engaged Fiction
2012 Morning Star Award for Creative Writing
2003 Yale University’s William H. McKim Prize
Alma Exley Minority Teaching Scholarship

div.span: “Beginning in elementary school, teachers throughout my Jackson County schools experience collectively instilled in me a love for literature and writing that has sustained me professionally and personally throughout my entire life.”

header.div: Emergency Room Doctor, Harris Regional Hospital

div.p:
WCU, Magna Cum Laude
UT-Knoxville, Chief Resident

div.span: “Jackson County schools gave me the foundation from which everything I have ever done is based. My teachers taught me education was a process that is never ending and knowledge is the platform from which all your dreams can come true. My coaches taught me there is no substitute for hard work and that through hard work and building on the strengths of those around you, there is nothing you can’t achieve.”

div.p:
2011-2015 UNC-Chapel Hill Basketball
2011 Associated Press All-State Selection
2011 WNC Basketball Player of the Year
State Record for Career Rebounds
School Record for Career Points

div.span: “The leadership of the administration and the desire of the teachers to help kids reach their potential allowed me to become the person I am today. The opportunities I had to expand my knowledge were vital to my enjoyment of college and broadening my perspective on higher education.”

div.p:
2012 Sports Emmy – Games of the XXX Olympiad
2014 WCU Young Alumnus Award
2015 Sports Emmy – The XXII Olympic Winter Games

div.span: ““I will always treasure the friendships and lessons I learned while attending school in Jackson County. Between the wonderful teachers, friends, and community, I cannot imagine a better place to grow up.””

header.div: Postdoctoral Scholar, North Carolina State University

div.span: “Being in Jackson County Schools from 1st grade through 12th grade equipped me with ample tools for success at the undergraduate and graduate levels of academia. The people in Jackson County Schools, from principals to teachers to guidance counselors to lunchroom personnel, set an example of excellence that I continue to follow.”

“Jackson County Public Schools really helped shaped who I am today. The teachers know your name, your strengths and your weaknesses. I never got lost between the cracks. Faculty and staff always helped me challenge myself and look for new and exciting opportunities. It was a very personal experience growing up within the school system and now after comparing it with my colleagues who went to private schools, boarding schools, or magnet schools, I would never change my experience staying within the school system kindergarten-12th grade.”

div.p:
Board of Directors for Full Spectrum Farms
Jackson County Chamber of Commerce
WCU Catamount Club

div.span: ““I give full credit for the success I have obtained during my business career to the education I received in Jackson County Public Schools. I don’t believe I could have had better or more caring teachers during elementary school and high school. I can’t think of a better choice than public schools in Jackson County.”

div.p:
SCC Associate in Science Degree
SCC President’s List President
National Honor Society
Eagle Scout

div.span: “Jackson County Schools gave me the opportunity to be a part of so much that was extremely beneficial to my future, not only as a college student, but also as an adult.””

header.div: We believe authentic learning takes place through the application of knowledge. Our highly-qualified staff recognize the diverse learning styles of our students and employ innovative strategies that make learning relevant and meaningful for all students regardless of their future path.

div.p: Students Developing Real-World Skills in 40 CTE Courses

From academics and arts to athletics and technical skills, Jackson County Public Schools has a place for you. We are your best option, because we provide the resources and opportunities you need to be successful. This is your invitation to become a part of the Jackson County Public Schools family.

br.em: Notice: Jackson County Public Schools is in the process of reviewing its website to ensure compliance with Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act and Title II of the Americans with Disabilities Act. If you have questions or concerns regarding the accessibility of the website or if you are unable to access a page or document on the website, you may email dproffitt@jcpsmail.org or phone (828) 586-2311.
